item.title: Internet
item.description: I am absorbed on the net Seeing the whole world Yet chained I remain And watch the time go I truly remain unhappy Trapped in this fake realm Ignoring family and friends To live my life virtual At last my phone goes out Freeing me of this burden Bringing light to my soul To show me the real world

item.title: Reality
item.description: The peace of silence is all but forgotten Giving time for me to ponder my thoughts Allowing me to see what is not noticed Bringing light to what I thought was gone I now see the truth of my world’s reality No longer do I remain so blind to atrocity Now is my time to take a form action And show the world the the power of unity

item.title: Stress
item.description: Dungeons of stress chain me Eating my freedom away At last I take time to relax To ease my ghastly pain And healing my lasting wounds Now letting me be away of fray The calm soothes my soul Making me feel reborn I feel ready to go out And face challenges of the world

item.title: UT
item.description: The city mighty of Austin Is home to my school I visit here often Cause my university is a jewel Home to the Longhorns of UT A school that is also an emotion Working hard to get my degree But that is not my real notion To meet people in my 4 years Giving me jolly tales to tell later Friends part ways as the future nears But our memories remain greater

item.title: Bhagwan
item.description: Hum naachate hain uske ishaaron par Azad hain hum nahi Issme hain humare khushi Kyon ki woh ho sabase mahaan Hum usse mahasoos nahi kar paate Phir bhee woh hai yahin Surarakshit hain hum tabhee Jab tak hain uske saath

item.title: Junior Year Is Over Already????
item.description: My Thoughts Well, I have to say this year is one to remember. Who ever thought COVID-19 would turn our lives upside down in a matter of weeks. It is still feels unreal to say that I was walking outside and hanging out with my friends, but now I am cooped up inside my house living with trepidation of not knowing what will happen next. The most difficult part to fathom is that I will not be able to see my friends for almost 6 months.

item.title: Social Isolation
item.description: People wait for their chance To go out and have a dance Yet he still prowls in wait Waiting of your date Nothing is more morbid Than COVID of the horrid He journeys to the lung And there remains clung May all proceed with caution Or fight him as an option

item.title: SDS 348 Project 2
item.description: Chandershekhar Shori, EID–cs56788 Introduction: The dataset chosen for this project is the SLID dataset, which can be found in the carData package and accessed by using library(carData). Each row of this dataset represents information collected from a single individual living in the Canadian province of Ontario and is part of the workforce. For this purposes of this project only complete data provided by individuals will be used for this project, and any rows containing NA values will be removed.

item.title: Should I use R, Python, or both?
item.description: Python Python and R are both fascinating on their own. However when put together, these two softwares can become a powerful tool that can solve complex issues. Below we have an example of how we have used Python to determine all possible k-mers of a particular sequence, which is particularly very useful in the field of bioinformatics. ##Python Chunk my_seq = "ATCATCATG" def k_mercount(sequence): subs = [sequence[x:x+3] for x in range(len(sequence)) if len(sequence[x:x+3]) > 2] kmers = {} for i in subs: if i in kmers: kmers[i] += 1 else: kmers[i] = 1 print(kmers) k_mercount(my_seq) ## {'ATG': 1, 'CAT': 2, 'ATC': 2, 'TCA': 2} R Now we will demonstrate the use of R on a dataset.

item.title: SDS 348 Project 1
item.description: Chandershekhar Shori, EID–cs56788 Introduction: The first data set chosen for this project is the lung dataset. The lung dataset contains data about survival among patients from the North Central Cancer Treatment Group. This dataset contains 10 variables, and these variables are inst, time, status, age, sex, ph.ecog, ph.karno, pat.karno, meal.cal, and wt.loss. The inst variable represents the institution code, the time variable represents the survival time in days, the status variable represents the censoring status, the age variable represents the age in years, meal.
